definition: to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

sentences.english: He always inoculates me with new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我給孩子們灌輸禮貌的思想。

sentences.english: Inculcation is the basic way of Marxist theory education.
sentences.chinese: 灌輸是馬克思主義政治教育的基本原則。

sentences.english: A performance based pricing structure instils confidence.
sentences.chinese: 性能爲基礎的定價結構灌輸信心。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to implant them the conciousness of a responsible great power.
sentences.chinese: 因此對他們灌輸開放負責的大國意識是十分必要的。

sentences.english: Inculcation theory is the fundamental principle and method for ideological education.
sentences.chinese: 灌輸論是思想政治教育的基本原則和基本方法。

sentences.english: Inspiration is necessary to inculcate the sense of unity, and to create economic ideals.
sentences.chinese: 灌輸同心協力的認識，創造經濟理想也是需要靈感的。

sentences.english: Imparting family values is a long-term process.
sentences.chinese: 灌輸種種家庭觀念是一個長期的過程。

sentences.english: Teachers often try to rub into the pupils that time and tide wait for no man.
sentences.chinese: 老師們經常向學生灌輸“歲月不待人”的思想。

sentences.english: In the household, young kids are imbued with concept of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭中，孩子從小就被灌輸自立自強的觀念。

sentences.english: The teacher transfused a love of literature to his students.
sentences.chinese: 老師向學生們灌輸對文學的愛好。

sentences.english: It instills confidence about your ability to conquer problems in the future.
sentences.chinese: 也爲你在未來處理問題灌輸了更多的自信。

sentences.english: Keep smiling and that alone will imbue others with happiness and joy.
sentences.chinese: 保持微笑，這都將灌輸別人的幸福和喜悅。

sentences.english: Week after week she inculcated good manners in her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 她一週又一週地把良好的禮節反覆灌輸給她的學生。

sentences.english: He inculcates religious doctrines in the form of stories.
sentences.chinese: 他灌輸宗教教義的形式，故事。

sentences.english: Even just passing gossip and hearsay can prime your mind for illness with potent effect.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕只傳傳流言蜚語和道聽途說都能灌輸強烈影響。

sentences.english: The language teacher pounds Latin into the heads of students.
sentences.chinese: 語言教師不斷地向學生的腦袋灌輸拉丁文。

definition: to proclaim/to make public or well known
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
